sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>coat rack</radical> will turn into a <radical>bundle</radical> of sticks if you <kanji>neglect</kanji> it. When you neglect a coat rack, the weight from the coats will pull all of the arms off, leaving it as a <kanji>sparse</kanji> stick.
meaningInfo: Picture this sparse, neglected coat rack. All of its arms and the coats that were on it have fallen off and are in a big pile on the ground.
readingMnemonic: You go up to the <kanji>neglect</kanji>ed coat rack and try to make things right by cleaning it with <reading>so</reading>ap (<ja>そ</ja>). But no matter how much you scrub, it won't get clean, the arms won't go back on.
readingInfo: If you neglect something for too long, not even a good soap scrub will bring it back. That goes for humans too. Take care of yourselves. Use soap.
